item.title: Object Calisthenics: First thoughts
item.description: We ran an Object Calisthenics variation of Coding Dojo on Wednesday night as part of ThoughtWorks Geek Night in Sydney. Object Calisthenics is an idea suggest by Jeff Bay in The ThoughtWorks Anthology , and lists 9 rules to writing better Object Oriented code. For those who haven’t seen the book, the 9 rules are: Use only one level of indentation per method Don’t use the else keyword Wrap all primitives and strings
